info.title: PowerFlex Manager REST API
info.description: Describes the API for PowerFlex Manager

400.description: Invalid parameter values

401.description: Login information not specified, or forbidden (user does not have privileges)

500.description: Internal server error

post.description: De-registers the Secure Remote Services connector.

400.description: Invalid parameter values

401.description: Login information not specified, or forbidden (user does not have privileges)

500.description: Internal server error

post.description: Enables SNMP and IPMI.

get.summary: Get a list of all credentials
get.description:
Retrieve a list of all credentials.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Specify sort columns in a comma-separated list of column names to sort. Default order is
ascending. Column name can be prefixed with a minus sign to indicate descending for that column.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify page limit, cannot exceed the system maximum limit.

400.description: Bad Request, verify that credential data object is correct.

post.description:
Add a new credential. 

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

**Caution:** This API only supports XML for request payloads. Both JSON and XML are supported for response payloads.

get.summary: Get credential by ID
get.description:
Find credential by type and id.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Bad Request, verify that credential data object is correct.

404.description: Credential to be updated was not found.

put.description:
Updates an existing credential.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

**CAUTION:** This API only supports XML for request payloads. Both JSON and XML are supported for response payloads.

400.description: Bad Request, verify credential type and id is correct.

delete.description:
Deletes an existing credential.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get DHCP settings

200.description: Retrieved DHCP settings from appliance successfully.

500.description: Unable to get DHCP settings from the appliance.

get.description:
Retrieve DHCP settings from virtual appliance.

Response Content-Type: application/json, application/xml

put.description:
Apply DHCP settings on virtual appliance.

Response Content-Type: application/json, application/xml

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: DHCPEntity object that needs to be set on appliance.

get.summary: Get deployment objects

200.description: All Deployment retrieved on filter, sort, paginate.

get.description:
Retrieve all Deployment objects with filter, sort, paginate which returns Array of Deployment.class.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Use full templates including resources in response.

400.description:
Invalid parameters to create Deployment or problems with the
Resource Adapters.

post.description:
Create new Deployment.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get a deployment
get.description:
Retrieve Deployment based on deployment ID.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Invalid parameters to update Deployment or problem with the Resource Adapters.

put.description:
Update Deployment.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

500.description: Unable to delete Deployment.

delete.description:
Delete Deployment -- this operation is idempotent. The operation removes the specified deployment from the appliance, but does not tear down the cluster resources.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get firmware compliance reports for a deployment

401.description: No login information specified in the request.

post.summary: Find available servers for template components

400.description: Invalid Parameters to getAvailableServers.

500.description: Unable to find available servers.

post.description:
Find available servers for template components.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

parameters.name: unique
parameters.description:
If true (the default), only assign a server to one component per deployment. Otherwise the
same server may be assigned to multiple components.

get.summary: Get device groups
get.description:
Retrieve all DeviceGroup from Inventory with filter, sort, paginate, return DeviceGroup which contains list of Managed Devices and User if it exists.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Valid filter columns: name,description,u
sers,devices,create
dBy,updatedBy,createdDate,updatedDate

400.description: Invalid DeviceGroup object to create in inventory, first error encountered error causes an error response to return. Call does not return a list of errors.

409.description: DeviceGroup already exists in inventory, first encountered error causes an error response to return. Call does not return a list of errors.

post.description:
Create DeviceGroup in Inventory.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get device group by refId
get.description:
Retrieve DeviceGroup from Inventory based on refId.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Invalid DeviceGroup id.

put.description:
Update DeviceGroup in Inventory

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Unable to delete DeviceGroup from inventory.

delete.description:
Delete DeviceGroup from Inventory.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Bad Request, verify Discovery request object is correct.

post.description:
Discover devices of IP range. 

This is the primary API for discovering a device.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get discovery requests

400.description: Problem with a query parameter, check response for details.

get.description:
Retrieve an Array of DiscoveryRequest.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get a device from the inventory

200.description: Discovery result retrieved for the job.

404.description: Job not found in the discovery.

get.description:
Retrieve Device from Inventory based on Id.

This API returns the DiscoveryRequest object. Once the DiscoveryRequest operation is complete, the DiscoveryRequest object is no longer retrievable. The API then returns a 404 status code. At this point, you need to look up the discovery device by using /ManagedDevice/{refId} GET (with a service tag).

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

delete.description:
Delete Device from Discover result -- this operation is idempotent.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get an array of discovery results
get.description:
Retrieve an Array of DiscoveryResults.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Bad Request, verify that Discovery request object is correct.

post.description:
Discover devices of IP range.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get managed devices
get.description:
Retrieve all Devices from Inventory with filter.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Invalid Device to create in inventory, first error encountered error causes an error response to return. Call does not return a list of errors.

409.description: Device already exists in inventory, first error encountered error causes an error response to return. Call does not return a list of errors.

post.description:
Create Device in Inventory and return array of Managed Devices created.

This API is not intended to be used for discovery. Use the /DiscoveryRequest API to add inventory.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get managed device based on reference ID
get.description:
Retrieve Device from Inventory based on refId.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Invalid Device.

put.description:
Update Device in Inventory.

This API is not intended to be used for discovery. Use the /DiscoveryRequest API to add inventory.

To update a device inventory, the best practice is to use a DELETE followed by an add of new inventory, instead of using PUT for /ManagedDevice.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

400.description: Unable to delete from inventory.

delete.description:
Delete Device from Inventory -- this operation is idempotent.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

get.summary: Get device firmware version based on reference ID

200.description: Devices retrieved from inventory on filter, sort, paginate.

get.description:
Retrieves the device firmware version from the inventory based on the refId.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

Update Device in Inventory.

Response Content-Type: application/xml, application/json

This API takes a deviceId query parameter. Here's an example showing how to use the query parameter: 

POST /ManagedDevice/update?deviceId=refId1,refId2,refId3,...

get.summary: Get NTP settings

200.description: Retrieved NTP settings from virtual appliance successfully.

500.description: Unable to get NTP settings from the virtual appliance.

get.description:
Retrieve NTP settings from virtual appliance.

Response Content-Type: application/json, application/xml

204.description: Successfully set the NTP settings to on.

500.description: Unable to turn on NTP settings on the appliance.

put.description:
Apply NTP settings on virtual appliance.

Response Content-Type: application/json, application/xml

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: NTPSetting object that needs to be set on virtual appliance

204.description: Successfully set the NTP settings to off.

500.description: Unable to turn off NTP settings on the appliance.

delete.description:
Turn off NTP settings on virtual appliance.

Response Content-Type: application/json, application/xml

put.description:
Allow an unsigned RCM file. 

This API supports the new feature added in version 3.8 for signing RCM files. Old RCM files which are still unsigned will go into the "needsApproval" state after download and will not be available for use at that stage. This API must be called in order to allow PowerFlex Manager to continue extracting and getting the RCM file into a ready state where it can be used for service deployment or node expansion.

RCM files that are correctly signed (version 3.8 or newer) do not require calling this API, as they will not go into the "needsApproval" state.

This API takes no payload and returns no response.

get.summary: Get a service template component by Id

parameters.name: forDeployment
parameters.description: Flag should not be used and is specified for internal processing only

parameters.name: forEdit
parameters.description: Flag for if response will be used editing the template component

get.summary: List service template components for the specified filter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Required filter. Should include at least serviceTemplate.templateId: (serviceTemplate.templateId eq "c52859c9-96d3-40ec-9b4a-bc0612a272cb") Search Operators: eq (equals), ne (not equal), ge (greater than equal), le (less than equal), gt (greater than), lt (less than), like, ilike, sw (starts with), ew (ends with), in, empty, notempty, null, notnull Search Controls: and, or, not: (name like "component-") and (name not ew "-local") Searching for Strings should use " delimiter around the String. Searching for "in" should be a comma separated list of values. Filtered result is supported on children- serviceTemplate, resources, parameters Example of parent level filter:  ((id eq "bf794626-b5d1-4538-9c42-5a91032ae397") and (cloned eq true)) Example of child level filter:  (parameters.value like "vcenter")

get.summary: Get a Volume by Id
List volumes for the specified filter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Required filter. Must include at least gateway and vcenter: (gatewayId eq "scaleio-100.68.85.82") or (vcenterId eq "vcenter-100.68.77.215") Search Operators: eq (equals), ne (not equal), ge (greater than equal), le (less than equal), gt (greater than), lt (less than), like, ilike, sw (starts with), ew (ends with), in, empty, notempty, null, notnull Search Controls: and, or, not: (gatewayId eq "scaleio-100.68.85.82") or (vcenterId not eq "vcenter-100.68.77.215") Searching for Strings should use " delimiter around the String. Searching for "in" should be a comma separated list of values.Filtered result is supported on children- datastores, sdcs Example of parent level filter:  ((gatewayId eq "scaleio-100.68.85.82") and (name like "test-HC-vol")) Example of child level filter:  (sdcs.ipAddress eq "10.125.78.20")

get.summary: Get a Volume by Id
List volumes for the specified filter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Required filter. Must include at least vcenter ID: (vcenterId eq vcenter-100.68.77.215). Also all columns from Datastore are available i.e. name, id etc. Search Operators: eq (equals), ne (not equal), ge (greater than equal), le (less than equal), gt (greater than), lt (less than), like, ilike, sw (starts with), ew (ends with), in, empty, notempty, null, notnull, and, or, not example of parent level filter:  (vcenterId eq vcenter-100.68.1.1) and (datacenterId eq datacenter-2) and (name eq datastore-1)  example of child level filter:  (volume.sizeInKb gt 16)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Valid sort columns are the same as in Datastore: name, id, etc

parameters.name: limit

get.summary: List Deployments for the specified filter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Search Operators: eq (equals), ne (not equal), ge (greater than equal), le (less than equal), gt (greater than), lt (less than), like, ilike, sw (starts with), ew (ends with), in, empty, notempty, null, notnull Search Controls: and, or, not: (name like "CO-") and (name not ew "-nodes") Searching for Strings should use " delimiter around the String. Searching for "in" should be a comma separated list of values. Filtered result is supported on children- deployedDevices, firmwareRepositoryEntity, softwareLicenseRepositoryEntity, softwareLicenseRepositoryEntity, namesRefs, assignedUserList, serviceTemplate, components, resources, parameters. Example of parent level filter:  ((id eq "bf794626-b5d1-4538-9c42-5a91032ae397") and (allUsersAllowed ne false)) Example of child level filter:  (deployedDevices.serviceTag like "JZ63")

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Search Operators: eq (equals), ne (not equal), ge (greater than equal), le (less than equal), gt (greater than), lt (less than), like, ilike, sw (starts with), ew (ends with), in, empty, notempty, null, notnull Search Controls: and, or, not: (displayName like "server-") and (displayName not ew "-XFJ") Searching for Strings should use " delimiter around the String. Searching for "in" should be a comma separated list of values. Filtered result is supported on children- deviceGroupList, deviceLastJobList, deployments Example of parent level filter:  (refId eq "vcenter-cluster1") Example of child level filter:  (deployments.id eq "bf794626-b5d1-4538-9c42-5a91032ae397")

asmCredential.title: asmCredential
asmCredential.description:
asmCredential

**Caution:** For the /Credential/ POST and /Credential/{id} PUT APIs, XML is required for request payloads.

The credential property must be constructed as a tag indicating the type of credential. The tag to use depends on the resource:

- For a node, use serverCredential
- For a switch, use iomCredential
- For a vCenter, use vCenterCredential
- For an Element Manager, use emCredential
- For a PowerFlex Gateway, use scaleIOCredential
- For a presentation server, use PSCredential
- For an operating system administrator, use OSCredential
- For an operating system user, use OSUserCredential
